DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Temperature Monitoring Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe another method of temperature monitoring used for the umbilical cord blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium._The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it). [Manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.

A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.
